com.schibsted.account

Class AuthClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.schibsted.account.AuthClient

  • public class AuthClient
extends java.lang.Object
    AuthClient handles both obtaining and introspecting OAuth tokens. Use AuthClient.Builder to create a new instance configured with the necessary URLs (see AuthClient.Environment to use pre-configured URLs for Schibsted account).

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  AuthClient.Builder
      Builder for configuring and creating a new instance of AuthClient.
      static class  AuthClient.Environment
      Markers for the different environments of Schibsted account.

    • Method Detail

      • clientCredentialsGrant

        public AccessToken clientCredentialsGrant()
        Obtains a client token, using the client credentials.
        Returns:
        the issued client token
        Throws:
        AccountSDKException - if a token could not be obtained
        See Also:
        Obtaining client tokens, OAuth 2.0 Client Credentials Grant

      • clientCredentialsGrant

        public AccessToken clientCredentialsGrant(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> scope)
        Obtains a client token, using the client credentials.
        Parameters:
        scope - requested scope of token
        Returns:
        the issued client token
        Throws:
        AccountSDKException - if a token could not be obtained
        See Also:
        Obtaining client tokens, OAuth 2.0 Client Credentials Grant

      • clientCredentialsGrant

        public AccessToken clientCredentialsGrant(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> scope,
                                          java.util.List<java.net.URI> resources)
        Obtains a client token (using the client credentials) with the given scope intended for the given resources.
        Parameters:
        scope - requested scope of token
        resources - intended resources of the token
        Returns:
        the issued client token
        Throws:
        AccountSDKException - if a token could not be obtained
        See Also:
        Obtaining client tokens, OAuth 2.0 Client Credentials Grant

      • authorizationCodeGrant

        public UserTokens authorizationCodeGrant(java.lang.String authCode,
                                         java.net.URI redirectURI,
                                         java.lang.String expectedNonce)
        Obtains user tokens (access token, ID Token, and possibly refresh token).
        Parameters:
        authCode - issued OAuth authorization code to exchange for tokens
        redirectURI - client redirect URI associated with the authorization code (specified in the authentication request, see getLoginURL(URI, String, String, Collection, Collection))
        expectedNonce - the nonce associated with the authorization code (specified in the authentication request)
        Returns:
        the issued user tokens
        Throws:
        AccountSDKException - if no tokens could be obtained
        See Also:
        Obtaining user tokens, OpenID Connect Authorization Code Flow

      • refreshTokenGrant

        public UserTokens refreshTokenGrant(java.lang.String refreshToken)
        Obtains new tokens, using a refresh token.
        Parameters:
        refreshToken - refresh token to use
        Returns:
        the refreshed tokens
        See Also:
        Refreshing tokens, OAuth 2.0 Refreshing an access token

      • getLoginURL

        public java.net.URI getLoginURL(java.net.URI redirectUri,
                                java.lang.String state,
                                java.lang.String nonce,
                                java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> scopes)
        Creates the login URL to redirect the user to, making an OpenID Connect authentication request.
        Parameters:
        redirectUri - URL (that must be pre-registered for the client) to which the response will be sent after the user authentication is completed
        state - opaque value to maintain state between the request and the response delivered to the redirectURI. This should be verified upon receiving the response, to prevent Cross-Site Request Forgery.
        nonce - opaque value to associate a session with the ID Token that will be issued on successful user authentication
        scopes - requested scope, must contain the "openid" value
        Returns:
        the URL to redirect the user to for authentication
        See Also:
        User login, OpenID Connect Authentication Request

      • getLoginURL

        public java.net.URI getLoginURL(java.net.URI redirectUri,
                                java.lang.String state,
                                java.lang.String nonce,
                                java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> scopes,
                                java.util.Collection<com.nimbusds.openid.connect.sdk.claims.ACR> acrValues)
        Creates the login URL to redirect the user to, making an OpenID Connect authentication request.
        Parameters:
        redirectUri - URL (that must be pre-registered for the client) to which the response will be sent after the user authentication is completed
        state - opaque value to maintain state between the request and the response delivered to the redirectURI. This should be verified upon receiving the response, to prevent Cross-Site Request Forgery.
        nonce - opaque value to associate a session with the ID Token that will be issued on successful user authentication
        scopes - requested scope, must contain the "openid" value
        acrValues - Optional field to request certain authentication methods. Possible values: pwd, sms, otp
        Returns:
        the URL to redirect the user to for authentication
        See Also:
        User login, OpenID Connect Authentication Request, Requesting the "acr" Claim

      • validateAccessToken

        public IntrospectionResult validateAccessToken(java.lang.String token,
                                               java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> requiredScopes,
                                               java.lang.String requiredAudience)
        Validates an access token, by introspecting it and checking has all required scopes and the expected audience.
        Parameters:
        token - token to validate
        requiredScopes - required scopes of the token
        requiredAudience - expected audience of the token
        Returns:
        the authorization data associated with the validated token
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if this instance is not configured to perform token validation
        InvalidTokenException - if the token is invalid
